text: rushing on the road to Kabul a taxi
carrying three-year-old Neela far who's
in a critical condition she urgently
needs specialist medical treatment after
being found bleeding badly near her
house she'd been raped allegedly by a
neighbor who apparently tried to kill
her
afterwards finally in the arms of her
grandmother she arrives at a Children's
Hospital in the capital she needs
surgery if she pulls through she'll also
need much psychological help to overcome
the trauma of what has happened she'd
been playing with friends when she was
attacked both the father and mother were
away at the time her father Abdul
says the stigma here of being raped will
destroy his daughter's life and made
this threat if the rapist is not brought
to justice if I don't get justice I will
do something five times worse than what
the rapist did I will bring my other six
children and kill them in front of the
presidential palace and I will leave
Afghanistan my wife and mother also say
they will kill themselves that
desperation is echoed by many other
families here whose children have also
been raped it is a big problem in this
very male-dominated and segregated
society but there are some signs that
the issue is now being confronted
seriously last month this Muslim cleric
was given a long prison sentence for
raping a ten-year-old girl he was
brought to Kabul for the trial because
of fears he'd be less off likely in the
courts in his home province the human
rights lawyer banoffee R FF who was
involved in the trial says it was a
breakthrough an example to society of
how they can push through these cases
and secure convictions
me show you on this special children's
shelter is also bringing hope to some
rape victims who've being looked after
and educated here while this girl cannot
go back to her village because she be
treated as an outcast she's doing very
well in class and is now planning to
become a doctor which a Galpin BBC News
Cabo
